title.narrative: Enhance protection response to new displaced and critically at risk population in Ninewa Governorate - IRAQ

description.narrative: Based on the experience, lesson learnt and good practices capitalized in the framework of the IHPF 2016 Second Standard Allocation project, which INTERSOS is currently implementing in Ninewa Governorate – Qayyara District (planned end date: 14/06/2017), INTERSOS aims at ensuring continuity of the activities currently implemented in the targeted area. INTERSOS intends to continue its protection program to contribute towards immediate responses to urgent protection needs, enhancing protection for newly displaced and critically at-risk populations, and increasing safety and promoting dignity of conflict-affected women, men, girls and boys, across Ninewa Governorate focusing mainly on 2 camps established in Qayyara district (Jeddah and Hajji Ali) and out-of-camp areas in Qayyara and Hamdanyya Districts. The overarching objective of the intervention is to contribute towards enhancing the first-line and second-line protection response both in camp settings (Jeddah and Hajji Ali) and out-of-camp areas (both in Qayyara and Hamdanyya district), through the deployment of specialized protection teams – mixing static and mobile approach - for increased identification and service delivery. The first-line protection response has been already activated during the current on-going project who timely respond to the first wave of displacement with monitoring of the main protection concerns and provision of specialized services (comprehensive case management, inclusive of PSS and referral, legal assistance and individual psychological counseling).The proposed services will be provided both in camps (Haj Ali and Jeddah camps in Qayyara) and out of camps (Qayyara area and Hamdaniyya area in complementarity with another INTERSOS project). The identification of the beneficiaries will be supported by the work of 6 protection monitors deployed in the framework of a UNHCR funded project, while the assistance provided will be based on needs and established SOPs. In addition to core project activities, INTERSOS shall regularly engage in protection mainstreaming initiatives with other humanitarian partners in its areas of operation, conduct protection assessments and advocate with authorities and security forces at the field level on specific IHL and protection concerns.
